articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Heads of State of Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Heads of State of Different Countries
						
 Jakarta, April 23 (KCNA correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, separately met and had friendly talks with Joko Widodo, president of the Republic of Indonesia, Truong Tan Sang, president of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, and Robert G. Mugabe, president of the Republic of Zimbabwe, in Jakarta on April 22 and 23 on the sidelines of the Asian-African Summit.
					 Kim exchanged views with the heads of state of different countries on the issue of developing bilateral relations and a series of international issues of mutual concern including the development of the non-aligned movement.
					
					 Meanwhile, Kim had a talk with Ibrahim Mahlab, prime minister of Egypt.

articles.title: Greetings to Tanzanian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Tanzanian President
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Thursday sent a message of greeting to Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete, president of Tanzania, on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the founding of the United Republic of Tanzania.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, highly appreciating the great achievements made by the government and people of Tanzania for the political stability and socio-economic development of the country after its independence.

articles.title: Delegation of Ministry of Oil Industry Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Delegation of Ministry of Oil Industry Leaves for Russia
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Oil Industry led by Minister Pae Hak left here Saturday to visit Russia.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association led by Chairman So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, left here Saturday to take part in the celebrations of the 40th anniversary of the liberation of South Vietnam and reunification.

articles.title: Delegation of Federation of Koreans in U.S. Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Federation of Koreans in U.S. Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. headed by Chairman Yun Kil Sang left here on Saturday. 
					 Meanwhile, a home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan led by Kim Ryong Won left here on the same day.

articles.title: Russian Government Economic Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian Government Economic Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- A government economic delegation of the Russian Federation headed by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for the Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Saturday.
					 The members of the delegation laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Russian Government Economic Delegation Laid Bouquets before Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Government Economic Delegation Laid Bouquets before Liberation Tower
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- A government economic delegation of the Russian Federation headed by Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the  DPRK-Russia Inter-governmental Committee for the Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology, visited the Liberation Tower on Saturday.
					 Also visiting were Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, officials concerned, Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets before the tower and observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Soviet Army who laid down in the battles for Korea's liberation.

articles.title: Commanding Officers of KPA Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Commanding Officers of KPA Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Hwang Pyong So, Hyon Yong Chol, Ri Yong Gil, Kim Won Hong and other commanding officers of the Korean People's Army visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun at 00:00 on April 25, the day of army-building.
					 A floral basket in the name of Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, was placed before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also laid was a floral basket in the name of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The participants paid a high tribute to the statues.
					
					 At the halls of immortality where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state they made bows to them in the humblest reverence.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches.

articles.title: Senior Party and State Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Senior Party and State Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju and other leading officials of the party and state and officials of the party and power bodies, Cabinet, ministries and national institutions visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Saturday, the 83rd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 Seen standing before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il was a floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Also seen standing before them was a floral basket in the name of the KPA.
					
					 Placed before the statues was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants paid profound tribute to the statues.
					
					 At the halls of immortality, they made bows to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and halls which house cars, an electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Delegations of People Visit KPA Units
articles.content:
Delegations of People Visit KPA Units
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- People's Delegations visited units of the Korean People's Army (KPA) on the occasion of its 83rd founding anniversary.
					 Service personnel of the units warmly welcomed the delegations.
					
					 Gifts sent by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un were conveyed to the service personnel.
					
					 The members of the delegations conveyed news from the rear and aid materials to service personnel.
					
					 They attended meetings and other diverse events held at the units in commemoration of KPA founding anniversary.
					
					 They watched soldiers' training and had talk with the soldiers who set examples in their combat and political training. 
					
					 They had sports and amusement games and art performances with service personnel.
					
					 They told the service personnel to firmly prepare themselves to be a-match-for-a-hundred fighters in hearty response to the order of the supreme commander.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Visits Cemeteries
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Visits Cemeteries 
						
Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here Saturday visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery to lay wreaths on the occasion of the 83rd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army. 
					Members of the military attaches corps laid bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and paid tribute to her. 
					
					Wreaths in the name of the military attaches corps were placed before the cemeteries. 
					
					They paid tribute to the anti-Japanese revolutionary martyrs and martyrs of the Korean People's Army.
					
					They went round the cemeteries.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Martyrs
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Martyrs 
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery and the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery on Saturday, the 83rd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 Seen on the wreath-laying stands of the cemeteries were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Pak Pong Ju and other leading officials of the party and state, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel and other people in Pyongyang.
					
					 The visitors laid bouquets and flowers before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and paid silent tribute to the memory of the woman commander of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Placed before the wreath-laying stand of the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong were wreaths in the names of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK. 
					
					 Also placed on the wreath-laying stand of the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery was a wreath in the joint name of the Central Committee of the WPK and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Laid before the wreath-laying stand "Soul of Heroes" of the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery was a wreath in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 Placed before the cemeteries were wreaths in the names of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, KPA units, scientific, educational, public health, media institutions and party and power bodies, city-level organs and farms in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The visitors paid silent tribute to the memory of the martyrs.
					
					 Wreaths were laid before the sculptures of martyrs, cemeteries and towers to the memory of KPA martyrs and at martyrs' cemeteries in different parts of the country on the same day.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Service personnel, people from all walks of life and school youth and children visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Saturday, the 83rd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 Seen standing before the statues on Mansu Hill was a floral basket sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 Placed before the statues were floral baskets in the name of the party, armed forces and power bodies, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, institutions, enterprises, factories, farms and schools at all levels in the city, and bouquets and flowers.
					
					 The visitors made bows to the statues in humble reverence.
					
					 Floral baskets, bouquets and flowers were placed before the statues at Kim Il Sung University, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, the Mansudae Art Studio and other places in Pyongyang.
					
					 Service personnel, working people and school youth and children paid floral tribute to the statues of the President and Kim Jong Il and mosaics depicting their beaming images at their residential quarters.

articles.title: Dancing Party of Women's Union Members Held
articles.content:
Dancing Party of Women's Union Members Held
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- A dancing party of members of the women's union took place at the plaza of the Arch of Triumph on Saturday, the 83rd anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army.
					 They danced to the tune of songs "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", "Victory Will Be Won Generation after Generation", "Our General Is the Best" and "Nilliri for Songun", recollecting with deep emotion the feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by laying a strong military foundation and turning the DPRK into a world military power and nuclear weapons state. 
					
					 The dancers looked more optimistic and enthusiastic when songs "Hullari," "Song of Mountains of Treasures" and "Tondollari" were played.
					
					 They presented dances to the tune of songs "July 27 March", "Let's Meet Each Other on the Front" and "Train to the Front" fully confident of achieving the final victory in the standoff with the U.S. imperialists by dint of great army-people unity shining in the history of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Dancing Parties of Youth and Students Celebrate Army Day
articles.content:
Dancing Parties of Youth and Students Celebrate Army Day
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Dancing parties of youth and students took place in Pyongyang and local areas on Saturday, the 83rd anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 At Pyongyang Railway Station, plaza of the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and other places in Pyongyang youth and students danced, recollecting the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation and strengthened the KPA into the powerful Paektusan revolutionary army.
					
					 They danced to the tune of songs "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", "Our General Is the Best", "Let Us Become the General's Soldiers" and "Guerrilla March".
					
					 The atmosphere of dancing parties revved up amid the playing of the song "Onghyeya".
					
					 Similar dancing parties were held in provincial seats, cities and counties on the same day.

articles.title: Invincible Korean People's Army
articles.content:
Invincible Korean People's Army
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 83rd anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The KPA, guided by the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Juche-based military idea and strategy and tactics, has made a glorious history of invincibility with its matchless pluck and courage.
					
					 Its tradition of victory is now being reliably carried forward under the guidance of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 At dawn of April 18, Kim Jong Un climbed the top of Mt. Paektu, the sacred mountain of revolution, together with fighter pilots to implant in the minds of all servicepersons the revolutionary spirit of Paektu, the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu and thus make the KPA polit-ideologically and morally stronger.
					
					 He wisely leads all the servicepersons to prepare themselves as stalwart fighters equipped with the ever-victorious Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il strategy and tactics, brave offensive methods and perfect real war capability by carrying through the four-point strategic line and the three major tasks the Workers' Party of Korea set forth to bolster up the nation's military capability.
					
					 To further strengthen the KPA and perfect its combat readiness, he has made ceaseless inspection of military units, including Panmunjom and forefront posts, day and night.
					
					 He personally guided various meetings of servicepersons, including the meetings of KPA company and battalion commanders and political instructors and the 1st Meeting of KPA Airpersons, and "the Combat Flight Contest among Air Commanding Officers of the Air and Anti-Air Force of the KPA-2014" and military drills of three services.
					
					 Under his energetic guidance the KPA has turned into a powerful elite army fully prepared in polit-ideological and military technical aspects.

articles.title: Tradition of Victory of Paektusan Army Is Being Given Steady Continuity: Papers
articles.content:
Tradition of Victory of Paektusan Army Is Being Given Steady Continuity: Papers
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers here Saturday editorially observe the 83rd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 An editorial of Rodong Sinmun says it is great pride of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea to have the Paektusan army which has successfully fulfilled its important mission to defend the country and nation, socialism and the destiny of mankind for a long period.
					
					 The 80 odd year-long history of the KPA is a proud history in which it created the tradition of great victory and has successfully carried forward it, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 The KPA has been praised by the world people as an invincible army as it has always won victories in the guerrilla war, battles between regular armed forces and protracted war minus gunfire fought against the enemies which incomparably outnumbered it.
					
					 The proud tradition of the victory of the KPA is being given steady continuity in the new century of Juche as it is holding Marshal Kim Jong Un, another great man of Paektusan type, as its supreme commander in high esteem.
					
					 The mental power and combat capabilities of the KPA are growing remarkably stronger than ever before in the great era of Kim Jong Un. This stirring reality convinces the Korean people that the history of victory of the heroic KPA will be given steady continuity and the revolutionary cause of Songun is sure to be crowned with the final victory.
					
					 The great era of Kim Jong Un marks the greatest heyday of growth of military muscle as the invincible might of the KPA is being given fuller play.
					
					 There were those who could narrowly escape death in the past Korean war but there will be no one who will sign a paper of surrender when the DPRK will finally conclude the confrontation with the U.S. 
					
					 Minju Joson says the Korean people always remain confident as there are the revolutionary armed forces advancing under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, holding high the flag bearing the immortal beaming images of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Ideologically and Morally Strong KPA Is Sure to Emerge Ever-victorious: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Ideologically and Morally Strong KPA Is Sure to Emerge Ever-victorious: Rodong Sinmun 
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The whole history of the Korean revolution is the history of its victory thanks to ideology and morality, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The Korean revolution started by dint of ideology and morality as it had to begin with nothing. It has emerged victorious, regarding ideology and morality as a powerful engine for struggle and changes. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists frantically manufactured all types of warships, aircraft, tanks, artillery pieces, etc. with the zealous backing of Western powers. They turned Korea into a colony by using those weapons. 
					
					 At that time President Kim Il Sung fathered the Juche idea, the guiding idea of the Korean revolution, bringing hope of national resurrection to the Korean people who were driven into despair. 
					
					 The President's speech "On the Occasion of Founding the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army" was a solemn declaration informing the whole world of the fact that Korea had its popular armed forces, invincible revolutionary army, the first of its kind in its history, and a declaration of war against the Japanese imperialists armed to the teeth. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists were finally defeated as they were ideologically and morally weak. 
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK achieved a shining victory in the last Fatherland Liberation War by defeating the U.S. imperialists, who boasted of being "the strongest" in the world, by dint of ideology and morality. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK have achieved a great victory in the struggle to defend socialism for more than five decades by dint of ideology and morality. 
					
					 A final victory is in store for the DPRK as it has ideologically and morally strong KPA.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Observes Anniversary of Publication of Kim Jong Un's Work
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Observes Anniversary of Publication of Kim Jong Un's Work
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday carries an article on the occasion of the publication of Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People".
					 Kim Jong Un published the work dealing with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il all their lives on April 20, Juche 101 (2012). 
					
					 The work indicates tasks for firmly preserving and upholding and eternally glorifying their ideas and exploits. 
					
					 Praising the President as a peerlessly great man who provided an eternal foundation for the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean revolution with his far-sighted wisdom, the article says: 
					
					 The President's undying feats are the most valuable treasure that enables the Korean revolution to make a dynamic advance along the road of independence.
					
					 At present independence is widely regarded as a symbol of the President's personality as a peerlessly great man and as everlasting banner for victory of Juche Korea.
					
					 His revolutionary history is characterized by his glorious Songun leadership as he started and advanced the revolution with arms.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces founded and developed by the President serve as reliable vanguard and unshakable mainstay of the Songun revolution and national defence industry built by him as an engine for building an economic power.
					
					 His immortal feats are eternal treasures making it possible for Korean-style socialism to shed its rays as an eternal land of bliss for the people.
					
					 Juche-oriented socialism, precious patriotic legacy left by the President, has become a permanent cradle of happiness for the people.
					
					 It is the firm will of Kim Jong Un to glorify before the world great Kim Il Sung's country and Kim Jong Il's Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Assails American-style "Standard of Human Rights"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Assails American-style "Standard of Human Rights" 
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The American-style "standard of human rights" can never be universally accepted because the U.S. has the worst record of human rights abuses, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in an article. 
					 If the American-style "standard of human rights" is universally accepted, the world will turn into a lawless one, tundra of human rights and the one of darkness, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is persistently insisting on its reactionary "standard of human rights" though it is facing stronger opposition and rebuff from the international community. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' "human rights" racket against the DPRK, in particular, has reached a very grave phase. The U.S. cooked up "North Korean Human Rights Act" and appointed a "special envoy for human rights issue in north Korea". 
					
					 Last year the U.S. cooked up the non-existent "human rights issue" of the DPRK in a vicious manner and prodded some European countries and Japan devoid of any viewpoint and principle into placing it on the agenda of the UN, thus staging a "human rights" racket against Pyongyang, something unprecedented in history. 
					
					 The U.S. "human rights" racket against the DPRK is nothing but a desperate bid of those who failed to disable the nuclear deterrence for self-defence and stifle the DPRK by force.
					
					 The purpose of the U.S. imperialists is to tarnish the international prestige of the DPRK and internationalize the moves to isolate and stifle it and secure a pretext for military aggression by hyping its "human rights issue." 
					
					 However, such deceptive "human rights" offensive does not work on the DPRK. 
					
					 The Korean people will resolutely shatter the U.S. vicious "human rights" offensive by dint of the single-minded unity.

articles.title: Minju Joson Calls for Putting Definite End to U.S.-S. Korea War Maneuvers
articles.content:
Minju Joson Calls for Putting Definite End to U.S.-S. Korea War Maneuvers
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises came to an end. They were staged by the U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers under the pretext of "annual defensive ones" despite the strong protest and denunciation at home and abroad.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Saturday terms Key Resolve and Foal Eagle unpardonable north-targeted nuclear war drills which undisguisedly encroached upon the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 Nevertheless, the puppet forces are going so impudent as to talk about "dialogue" and "improved relations" without giving any assurance against the resumption of similar saber-rattling with the U.S.
					
					 We are well aware that the U.S. seeks to exhaust its rival through a carrot- and stick-approach and watch for a chance to mount a preemptive military attack. Such clumsy method will never work on the DPRK.
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that if the DPRK shows good faith with magnanimity, the puppet group will resort to delaying tactics under this or that pretext just as it did in the past and torpedo dialogue through north-targeted nuclear war maneuvers.
					
					 It is only foreign forces that will like the repetition of such vicious cycle on the Korean peninsula. That is why we do not feel any need to negotiate with the puppet group acting as the U.S. waiting maid and war servant keen on the confrontation with fellow countrymen in the north, utterly indifferent to the settlement of the national issue through dialogue.
					
					 Clear is the stand of the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 It is the fixed will of the army and people of the DPRK to put a definite end to the aggressors' ever escalating north-targeted nuclear war drills through merciless toughest counterattack and pave a wide avenue to independent reunification.

articles.title: U.S. Slammed for Its Moves to Deploy THAAD in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Slammed for Its Moves to Deploy THAAD in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association on April 6 posted on its internet homepage an article denouncing the U.S. for seeking to deploy THAAD in south Korea.
					 The article said:
					
					 The U.S. is examining the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.
					
					 This will spark off the rebuff of those countries around the Korean peninsula and arms race. The Koreans will be the first victims of its burden.
					
					 We resolutely oppose the U.S. deployment of THAAD disturbing peace and security in the region and holding in check the conclusion of a peace agreement in Korea.
					
					 The article referred to the DPRK's principled stand in this regard.
					
					 When public opinions at home and abroad are becoming increasingly vocal opposing the deployment of THAAD, the south Korean authorities are pretending that no decision has not been made as they should dance to the tune of the U.S. war moves, the article noted, adding: 
					
					 This is little short of an artifice to deceive surrounding countries.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Apology and Reparation for Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Apology and Reparation for Its Past Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held the 1175th Wednesday rally on April 22 to force Japan to settle the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 Speakers accused Japanese prime minister Abe of shamelessly shunning reflection and apology for Japan's past war crimes and evading the  blame for them as evidenced by his remarks painting the victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army as "ones of flesh traffic" and his ritual offering to Yasukuni Shrine.
					
					 The U.S. is telling people to forget the disgraceful history, unilaterally siding with Japan's militarization and lurch to the Right and working hard to hold its military hegemony in Northeast Asia, they charged.
					
					 Japan's moves for militarization including the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense" are doing harm to peace in Northeast Asia and other parts of the world, they noted.
					
					 They declared they would carry on their actions for peace and reunification on the Korean peninsula and peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					 They demanded the Japanese government stop distorting history and make an official apology and legal reparation for the past war crimes including the crimes related to sexual slavery.

articles.title: KCTU's General Strike Supported by S. Koreans
articles.content:
KCTU's General Strike Supported by S. Koreans
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- At least 1 000 civic and public organizations of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on April 21 in support of the April 24 general strike of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU).
					 The secretary general of the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society said that the guarantee of basic labor right, increase of public pension, drastic increase of the minimum wage, probe into truth about the ferry Sewol disaster and abolition of the "regime's enforcement ordinance" demanded by the KCTU are all just calls.
					
					 The director of the Unification Study Center branded the Park Geun Hye regime as "the regime infected with diseases" making the society rotten, adding the KCTU's general strike is one to topple the rotten Park regime.
					
					 The permanent co-representative of the Strength of the People said that the regime defined the strike as "illegal one" and is planning wholesale suppression of it. Lurking behind this is an attempt to conceal the truth about the power-backed fraudulent election and the scandal disclosed by the Song Wan Jong case, he added.
					
					 The chairman of the Federation of Distribution Traders said that majority of self-supporting businessmen are those who suffered losses due to capital and the regime, positively supporting the strike of the KCTU.
					
					 The chairman of the Federation of Peasants Associations and the co-representative of the Solidarity for Liberation of the Poor accused the regime of regarding the workers as slaves, declaring peasants and the poor would join the KCTU in its general strike.
					
					 The chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification called upon the KCTU to take the lead in the strike and peasants, urban poor, common people and all other people to get united to drive the Park regime into a cesspool.
					
					 The chairman of the KCTU called for positive actions to save workers and other common people.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Infringing upon Freedom of Assembly and Expression
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Infringing upon Freedom of Assembly and Expression 
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea on April 21 held a press conference in front of the building of the puppet Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office in denunciation of the puppet police's suppression.
					 Speakers recalled that on April 10 the police clamped down on a peaceful rally held by more than 40 civic organizations including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in protest against the deployment of THAAD in south Korea and for the immediate transfer of OPECON.
					
					 They also condemned the police authorities for barring in a premeditated and organized manner the press conference and peaceful action conducted in protest against the south Korea-Japan consultative meeting on security policy on April 14.
					
					 They demanded the prosecution thoroughly investigate and severely punish the police trampling down the freedom of assembly and expression.
					
					 At the end of the press conference the organization filed a written complaint in the prosecution against the puppet police's violence.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Evading Blame for Heinous Scandal
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Evading Blame for Heinous Scandal
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Seoul Sinmun on April 23 in an editorial accused the puppet authorities of evading the blame for heinous scandal.
					 The editorial recalled that as regards the "prime minister's" tendering of his resignation Park Geun Hye said she hoped that the "prosecution would make a proper investigation on the level of political reform to probe the truth."
					
					 The Song Wan Jong case is the worst scandal of those in power in history as leading confidants of Park including the former and incumbent Presidential chiefs were involved in it, the editorial noted, and continued:
					
					 However, Park is issuing instructions only, regarding the scandal as others' wrong, without saying even a word of apology though she is responsible for the state administration. 
					
					 Now is the time to focus efforts on rooting out the corruption of those in power by the way of surgical operation, not to just vociferate about political reform. 
					
					 The above-said case would have been unthinkable apart from illicit political funds for "presidential elections" in 2007 and 2012. 
					
					 The resignation of Ri Wan Gu does not mean the end of the vicious scandal in which core elements of the regime were involved.

articles.title: Oceanic Regional Committee for Celebrating 70th Anniversaries of Korea's Liberation and WPK Formed
articles.content:
Oceanic Regional Committee for Celebrating 70th Anniversaries of Korea's Liberation and WPK Formed
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- An Oceanic regional committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed on March 26.
					 Peter Woods, co-chairman of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea, was elected advisor to the regional committee and Don Borrie, chairman of the New Zealand-DPRK Society, chairman of the regional committee.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Missions
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries and regional organizations paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions on April 14 and 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They laid floral baskets and bunches of flowers before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their full-length pictures and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Among them were the director of the Asian Department of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples, first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, former minister of Commerce and Industry of Mongolia, former Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK and other personages of political parties, organizations and institutions including the department of foreign relations and cooperation of the Mongolian People's Party, Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development, Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche, Mongolia-Democratic Korea Friendship Bridge Association, Mongolian Agriculture, Food and Environment Workers' Trade Unions and the Socialist Unionist Party of Syria, the secretary general and the director of the political department of the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America and representatives of foreign political parties in Cuba.
					
					 Meanwhile, the secretary general of the Malaysian People's Movement Party, the general director of M.K.P. Company and other personages of Malaysia sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassy.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Nepali Paper
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The full text of Marshal Kim Jong Un's New Year Address was carried by the April issue of the Nepali paper Majodur Kissan.
					 The paper carried his photo.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated in Different Countries 
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Seminars on his works, reading sessions and meetings were held by the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and at the Milano Center for the Study of the Juche Idea of Italy and photo and book exhibitions and film shows at the Pretoria City Library of South Africa and the Kuwait Times between April 9 and 15.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display were their works, books and photos introducing the efforts of the service personnel and people of the DPRK for building a thriving socialist nation and the true picture of Songun Korea. 
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Pyongyang Today".

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreigners
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreigners
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in Russia, Mexico, Mali, Guinea and Angola between April 2 and 13 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The chairman of the "Jongilbong" Russia-Korea Friendship Association of Ulyanovsk Region praised the President as the outstanding revolutionary who devoted his all to the sacred cause for the people's freedom and happiness.
					
					 The chairman of the Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and Leader Kim Jong Il praised the President as the great statesman who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and turned the DPRK into the socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence and world elder statesman who made an immortal contribution to the socialist cause and the cause of popular masses for independence.
					
					 The principal of Progres School of Mali noted that the President, the founding-father of socialist Korea, was not only the leader of a country but also the father responsible for people's life and destiny. 
					
					 He referred to the life of patriotic devotion of the President who devoted his all to the people.

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo and Art Exhibitions Open in Different Countries
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo and Art Exhibitions Open in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and art exhibitions were opened in Russia, China and Malaysia between April 13 and 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at the venues of the exhibitions were photos documenting the exploits of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display were their works, books and photos introducing the efforts of the service personnel and people of the DPRK stepping up the building of a thriving socialist nation and the true picture of Songun Korea and art works associated with the talents of the Korean people.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremonies on invitation were personages and masses of relevant countries, officials of DPRK missions and various units working in those countries.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bunches of flowers before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con jefes de Estado de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con jefes de Estado de varios paises
						
Yakarta, 23 de abril (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, quien participa en la Cumbre Asia-Africa, se reunio los dias 22 y 23 en Yakarta con el presidente de la Republica de Indonesia, Joko Widodo, el presidente de la Republica Socialista de Vietnam, Truong Tan Sang, el presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Hassan Rouhani y el presidente de la Republica de Zimbabwe, Robert G. Mugabe, respectivamente  en un ambiente amistoso.
					En las ocasiones, Kim intercambio con ellos opiniones sobre una serie de los problemas internacionales de interes mutuo inclusive el del desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales y del Movimiento de los No Alineados.
					
					Por otra parte, Kim Yong Nam departio con el premier de la Republica Arabe de Egipto, Ibrahim Mahlab.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Tanzania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Tanzania
Pyongyang, 25 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Unida de Tanzania, Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete, en ocasion del 51o aniversario de la fundacion de ese pais.
					En su misiva, el remitente evaluo altamente notables exitos logrados por el gobierno y el pueblo de Tanzania en su empeno por lograr la estabilidad politica y el desarrollo socioeconomico del pais.
					
					Manifesto la conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Cuadros rinden homenaje a Generalisimos en el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
articles.content:
Cuadros rinden homenaje a Generalisimos en el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan 
						
Pyongyang, 25 de abril (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 83o aniversario de la fundacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Pak Pong Ju y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado, y los funcionarios de los organismos del partido y el poder, el Consejo de Ministros, ministerios y organos centrales visitaron este sabado el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					Ante las estatuas de pie de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il estaban colocados un cesto de flores a nombre del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y Comandante Supremo del EPC, y el otro a nombre del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Fue depositado un cesto de flores a nombre comun del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Comite de Defensa Nacional, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Los participantes rindieron postumo homenaje a los Generalisimos ante sus estatuas de pie y se dirigieron a los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos. 
					
					Luego, pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de ordenes recibidas por los Generalisimos, las otras de conservacion de carros, coche electrico, barco y vagones de tren usados por ellos hasta el ultimo periodo de sus vidas para las visitas de orientacion en el terreno y los viajes al extranjero.

articles.title: Comandantes del EPC rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Comandantes del EPC rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, 25 de abril (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de Fundacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Hwang Pyong So, Hyon Yong Chol, Ri Yong Gil, Kim Won Hong y otros comandantes del EPC visitaron a la hora 0 del dia 25 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan para rendir homenaje postumo a los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il.
					Fueron depositados ante las estatuas de pie de los Generalisimos el cesto de flores a nombre del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del EPC, y el otro en nombre del EPC.
					
					Los visitantes rindieron tributo a los Generalisimos en los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos
					
					Luego, pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de ordenes recibidas por los lideres antecesores y las otras de conservacion de carros, coche electrico, barco y vagones de tren usados por ellos.

articles.title: Coreanos rinden homenaje a martires en el dia de fundacion del EPC
articles.content:
Coreanos rinden homenaje a martires en el dia de fundacion del EPC 
						
Pyongyang, 25 de abril (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 83o aniversario de fundacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea, fueron colocadas este sabado las ofrendas florales ante el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong, el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos y el Cementerio de Martires de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En esos lugares estaban colocadas las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					En las ceremonias de homenaje participaron Pak Pong Ju y otros cuadros del partido y el Estado, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, el Consejo de Ministros, entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, Generala del monte Paektu, tras depositar ramos y ramitas de flores ante su busto en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong.
					
					Fueron colocadas en el mismo cementerio las ofrendas florales a nombre del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Tambien fueron depositadas una ofrenda floral a nombre comun del Comite Central del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC en el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos, y la otra a nombre comun del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC en el Cementerio de Martires de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					Ademas, fueron puestas las ofrendas florales a nombre del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, las entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, unidades del EPC, instituciones de ciencia, educacion, salud publica, prensa e informacion, y los organismos del partido y el poder, organos y granjas a nivel urbano en esta capital.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires.
					
					Este dia, las ceremonias de homenaje se realizaron tambien ante las estatuas de bronce, cementerios, monumentos y tumbas de martires en distintas localidades del pais.
